docs.lead_paragraph: Questions have been raised over the methodology of a 2010 study that reported a steep fall in Afghanistan’s maternal mortality rate, which is used to measure improvement in a nation’s health.

headline.main: Reported Gains in Afghan Maternal Health Are Found to Be Implausible
headline.print_headline: Health Report on Childbirth by Afghans Is Challenged

docs.abstract: British and Irish Agencies Afghanistan Group finds improvement in maternal mortality rate in Afghanistan reported by United States Agency for International Development in 2010 is implausible; 2010 study claimed that maternal mortality had dropped to 327 in 2010 from 1,600 deaths in 2002 for every 100,000 live births.
docs.snippet: Questions have been raised over the methodology of a 2010 study that reported a steep fall in Afghanistan’s maternal mortality rate, which is used to measure improvement in a nation’s health.

keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A South Carolina woman who hid her pregnancy and buried her newborn son in her backyard after he died has pleaded guilty to unlawful neglect of a child.

headline.main: Woman Who Buried Baby in Backyard Sentenced to Probation
headline.print_headline: Woman Who Buried Baby in Backyard Sentenced to Probation

docs.snippet: A South Carolina woman who hid her pregnancy and buried her newborn son in her backyard after he died has pleaded guilty to unlawful neglect of a child.

docs.lead_paragraph: A tool to edit human genes is nowhere near ready to use for pregnancy — but altering early embryos as part of careful laboratory research should be allowed as scientists and society continue to grapple with the ethical questions surrounding this revolutionary technology, organizers of an international summit concluded Thursday.

headline.main: No Designer Babies, but Summit Calls for Cautious Research
headline.print_headline: No Designer Babies, but Summit Calls for Cautious Research

docs.snippet: A tool to edit human genes is nowhere near ready to use for pregnancy — but altering early embryos as part of careful laboratory research should be allowed as scientists and society continue to grapple with the ethical questions surrounding...

docs.lead_paragraph: A hot new tool to edit the human genetic code has a big wow factor: the promise of long-sought cures for intractable diseases. But depending on how it's used, that same tool could also alter human heredity.

headline.main: Scientists, Ethicists Tackle Gene Editing's Ethics, Promise
headline.print_headline: Scientists, Ethicists Tackle Gene Editing's Ethics, Promise

docs.snippet: A hot new tool to edit the human genetic code has a big wow factor: the promise of long-sought cures for intractable diseases. But depending on how it's used, that same tool could also alter human heredity.

docs.lead_paragraph: A swirl of wool or suede can be a romantic alternative to the usual dreary outerwear.
docs.snippet: A swirl of wool or suede can be a romantic alternative to the usual dreary outerwear.

docs.lead_paragraph: When it costs more to smoke, fewer babies die. That's according to a new study that links rising cigarette taxes with declines in infant mortality, especially among blacks.

headline.main: Rising Cigarette Taxes Tied to Lower Infant Deaths: Study
headline.print_headline: Rising Cigarette Taxes Tied to Lower Infant Deaths: Study

docs.snippet: When it costs more to smoke, fewer babies die. That's according to a new study that links rising cigarette taxes with declines in infant mortality, especially among blacks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Emily Nyoni was enjoying studying at Bunju secondary school in Dar es Salaam and hoped to pursue medical studies to become a doctor until she found out she was pregnant and was expelled.

headline.main: Let Pregnant Girls Return to School in Tanzania, Campaigners Plea
headline.print_headline: Let Pregnant Girls Return to School in Tanzania, Campaigners Plea

docs.snippet: Emily Nyoni was enjoying studying at Bunju secondary school in Dar es Salaam and hoped to pursue medical studies to become a doctor until she found out she was pregnant and was expelled.

docs.lead_paragraph: A rapid increase in the number of U.S. women turning to intra-uterine devices to prevent pregnancy has prompted escalating attacks on the birth control method from groups that oppose abortion.

headline.main: IUD Use Attracts New Opposition From Anti-Abortion Groups
headline.print_headline: IUD Use Attracts New Opposition From Anti-Abortion Groups

docs.snippet: A rapid increase in the number of U.S. women turning to intra-uterine devices to prevent pregnancy has prompted escalating attacks on the birth control method from groups that oppose abortion.

headline.main: Adele on Love, Fame, Ego and ‘25’

docs.lead_paragraph: One reader says political rhetoric against abortion incites violence; another says don’t blame the pro-life movement as a whole for the Colorado murders.

headline.print_headline: The Killings at a Colorado Clinic
